definition: odd number (on a ticket, house etc)
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people

sentences.english: Supplier must have purchase order number which was provided by Purchasing.
sentences.chinese: 供应商必须持有采购部提供的采购单号。

sentences.english: Please use it in any correspondence with us.
sentences.chinese: 请用这个单号跟我们联系。

sentences.english: For example, it may be necessary to find the process instance by the specific order number.
sentences.chinese: 例如，可能需要通过特定的订单号寻找流程实例。

sentences.english: Certainly, Ms. Ransom. Do you have an order number?
sentences.chinese: 当然可以，兰森夫人。你有订单号么？

sentences.english: What reference is made to the delivery note number?
sentences.chinese: 出货单的单号是否有参考文件？

sentences.english: The entrance is for odd numbers.
Before you can complete the task, you need to query out it by the order number.
sentences.chinese: 完成任务之前，您需要通过订单号查询出任务。

sentences.english: Please read carefully the explanatory noted on the reserve side of the Letter of Transmittal.
sentences.chinese: 请您仔细阅读在交付单号预备栏上的注释说明。

sentences.english: The purchase order number is used as the key for event sequencing.
sentences.chinese: 这个购物订单号被用作事件排序的键。

definition: even number (on a ticket, house etc)
to put together an order of goods
to sign for the acceptance of sth (e.g. a delivery etc)
remainder (after rounding a number)/decimal part (of number after the decimal point)/mantissa (i.e. fractional part of common logarithm in math.)/small change/balance (of an account)
